message: Does anybody have a storyform they've worked out for "The Karate Kid"?

Here are my settings:
Driver: Action (move to California/Ends with Tournament)
Limit: Optionlock (Only so many ways to try to fit in)

Outcome: Success (Johnny accepts him after the fight)
Judgement: Good ("We did it, Mr. Miyagi!")

MC Domain: Situation (New Kid)
SS Domain: Physics (Learn Karate)

MC Mental Sex: Male (If I learn Karate, my problems will go away)
OC Mental Sex: Female (Achieve balance in life)

MC Concern: The Present

SS Concern: Learning
SS Benchmark: Doing

MC Issue: Attraction
MC Focus: Non-acceptance
MC Problem/Solution: Proaction/Reaction
Some of this brings up questions for me. The MC Signpost 4 is "The Past", for instance.

How do you see Daniel employing a solution of Reaction in the end? How do you see Conceiving as the Goal? I haven't seen in it in a million years but my guess would be that the domains are the classic Uni MC, Mind IC, Psych SS and Physics OS, prob. a Doing Concern with a Problem of Test.
PS. I've decided that using Dramatica as an analysis tool is really just a way of analyzing how poor I am at using Dramatica as an analysis tool.

You are probably right. I just think it leaps right out that the SS is about Learning Karate, and can't see how it's about Psychology. 

Perhaps it's about why you learn Karate, or how you learn Karate?
Hah. Isn't Miyagi manipulating him to think differently? Paint the fence, wax the car, changing how Danielson thinks of the world, how he sees things? I'm gonna have to watch it again.
I chalked that up to "understanding." At issue here is my almost complete blindness to seeing the psychology domain.

That would mean that there struggle was a physical one, that they were running away, fighting, kicking each other. Their relationship's issues would be about the activities. From what I remember the whole paint the fence/wax the car/do the crane move was more about the way Daniel saw things, not that there was some subterfuge or misunderstanding going on between them.
The understanding you see could be about their roles in the Objective Story (Protagonist and Guardian) but the relationship between mentor/mentee is more about Daniels thought process.
I admit that I thought it could be a physical thing, or about a physical thing. The way the IC Concern can be that character's concern, or how they bring up those issues in the MC.

Re. the following extract:   << "You are probably right. I just think it leaps right out that the SS is about Learning Karate, and can't see how it's about Psychology.

Perhaps it's about why you learn Karate, or how you learn Karate?">>    For me, the SS domain is definitely about the WHY not about the DOING in this film.  Learning karate, imo, is just a method to demonstrate the greater understanding / attitude Daniel(son) develops.

Just to add, with 5 mins looking at this (which is likely not enough time), I would say for me the following is a basis for a storyform (sorry, don't know how to do line breaks): MC Domain: Universe/Situation SS Domain: Psychology MC Concern: Progress ....and so far would say.......... MC Problem: Determination MC Focus: Hunch (although not sure abotu problem and focus).                                                 For me, this film was all about someone not being able to adjust or deal with new situations, until help (Myagi) showed them that they were more than capable.
